title: Unionist campaigner takes legal action against Brexit deal, claiming it breaches Good Friday Agreement
text:
A unionist campaigner has launched legal proceedings against Boris Johnson which claim that his Brexit deal breaches the Good Friday Agreement.

Jamie Bryson, an activist who runs the political website Unionist Voice, said Mr Johnson’s deal failed to meet the requirements of the 1998 peace treaty because it does not grant the Northern Ireland Assembly a veto.

Mr Bryson’s lawyers wrote to the Government on Tuesday requesting a judicial review, warning that their client “is gravely concerned with the Prime Minister’s 11th hour retreat from previously stated policy that Her Majesty’s Government would not allow the creation of a border in the Irish sea".

The case will argue that the deal falls short...
description: A unionist campaigner has launched legal proceedings against Boris Johnson which claim that his Brexit deal breaches the Good Friday Agreement.
